segments.text: From my place, I see everything—the chaos, the negligence, the innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman remains blissfully unaware of the small disaster forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water, cascading down like a waterfall, feels almost beautiful in its own way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But beauty can be deceptive, especially when mixed with danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy stands perilously on the stool, so determined to reach those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself holding my breath, waiting to see how this will end.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: At that moment, I almost want to intervene but know it’s merely a scene unfolding.
segments.speaker: PAR
